intro: Aporosa flexuosa, commonly known as the creeping aporosa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Aporosa flexuosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
